aws.iam#iamAction.documentation: Grants permission to create new clusters.

traits.smithy.api#documentation: Creates a cluster in Amazon Aurora DSQL.
If enabled, you can't delete your cluster. You must first disable this property before you can delete your cluster.
A map of key and value pairs to use to tag your cluster.

A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, the subsequent retries with the same client token return the result from the original successful request and they have no additional effect.

If you don't specify a client token, the Amazon Web Services SDK automatically generates one.
The ID of the created cluster.
The ARN of the created cluster.
The status of the created cluster.
The time of when created the cluster.
Whether deletion protection is enabled on this cluster.
Output Mixin

aws.iam#iamAction.documentation: Grants permission to create multi-Region clusters. This action requires the CreateMultiRegionClusters and CreateCluster permissions in each specified linked Region.

traits.smithy.api#documentation: Creates multi-Region clusters in Amazon Aurora DSQL. Multi-Region clusters require a linked Region list, which is an array of the Regions in which you want to create linked clusters. Multi-Region clusters require a witness Region, which participates in quorum in failure scenarios.
An array of the Regions in which you want to create additional clusters.
A mapping of properties to use when creating linked clusters.
The witness Region of multi-Region clusters.

A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully. The subsequent retries with the same client token return the result from the original successful request and they have no additional effect.

If you don't specify a client token, the Amazon Web Services SDK automatically generates one.
An array that contains the ARNs of all linked clusters.

This is an interface reference for Amazon Aurora DSQL. It contains documentation for one of the programming or command line interfaces you can use to manage Amazon Aurora DSQL.

Amazon Aurora DSQL is a serverless, distributed SQL database suitable for workloads of any size. Aurora DSQL is available in both single-Region and multi-Region configurations, so your clusters and databases are always available even if an Availability Zone or an Amazon Web Services Region are unavailable. Aurora DSQL lets you focus on using your data to acquire new insights for your business and customers.

UseFIPS.documentation: When true, send this request to the FIPS-compliant regional endpoint. If the configured endpoint does not have a FIPS compliant endpoint, dispatching the request will return an error.

Endpoint.documentation: Override the endpoint used to send this request

Region.documentation: The AWS region used to dispatch the request.

aws.iam#iamAction.documentation: Grants permission to delete a cluster and all of its data.

traits.smithy.api#documentation: Deletes a cluster in Amazon Aurora DSQL.
The ID of the cluster to delete.

A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully. The subsequent retries with the same client token return the result from the original successful request and they have no additional effect.

If you don't specify a client token, the Amazon Web Services SDK automatically generates one.
The ID of the deleted cluster.
The ARN of the deleted cluster.
The status of the cluster.
The time of when the cluster was created.
Specifies whether deletion protection was enabled on the cluster.
Output Mixin

aws.iam#iamAction.documentation: Grants permission to delete multi-Region clusters. This action requires the DeleteMultiRegionClusters and DeleteCluster permissions in each specified linked Region.

traits.smithy.api#documentation: Deletes a multi-Region cluster in Amazon Aurora DSQL.
The ARNs of the clusters linked to the cluster you want to delete. also deletes these clusters as part of the operation.

aws.iam#iamAction.documentation: Grants permission to get a list of cluster ARNs associated with the current endpoint and account.

traits.smithy.api#documentation: Retrieves information about a list of clusters.
An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to display the next page of results.
If your initial ListClusters operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in following ListClusters operations, which returns results in the next page.
If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. To retrieve the next page, make the call again using the returned token.
An array of the returned clusters.

aws.iam#iamAction.documentation: Grants permission to modify the deletion protection status of a given cluster.

traits.smithy.api#documentation: Updates a cluster.
The ID of the cluster you want to update.
Specifies whether to enable deletion protection in your cluster.

A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully. The subsequent retries with the same client token return the result from the original successful request and they have no additional effect.

If you don't specify a client token, the Amazon Web Services SDK automatically generates one.
The ID of the cluster to update.
The ARN of the updated cluster.
The status of the updated cluster.
The time of when the cluster was created.
Whether deletion protection is enabled for the updated cluster.
The Region that receives all data you write to linked clusters.
The ARNs of the clusters linked to the updated cluster. Applicable only for multi-Region clusters.
